name: UITextChecker
desc: An object to check a string (usually the text of a document) for misspelled words.

items.name: func rangeOfMisspelledWord(in: String, range: NSRange, startingAt: Int, wrap: Bool, language: String) -> NSRange
items.desc: Initiates a search of a range of a string for a misspelled word.

items.name: func guesses(forWordRange: NSRange, in: String, language: String) -> [String]?
items.desc: Returns a list of words that are possible valid replacements for a misspelled word.

items.name: func completions(forPartialWordRange: NSRange, in: String, language: String) -> [String]?
items.desc: Returns an array of strings that are possible completions for a partially entered word.

items.name: func ignoreWord(String)
items.desc: Tells the text checker to ignore the specified word when spell-checking.

items.name: var ignoredWords: [String]?
items.desc: Returns the words that the text checker ignores when spell-checking.

items.name: class func learnWord(String)
items.desc: Tells the text checker to learn the specified word so that it doesn’t evaluate it as misspelled.

items.name: class func unlearnWord(String)
items.desc: Tells the text checker to unlearn the specified word.

items.name: class func hasLearnedWord(String) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns whether the text checker has learned the specified word.

items.name: class var availableLanguages: [String]
items.desc: Returns the languages that the text checker’s class can perform spell-checking for.
